speaker: s02e03c02u001
line: Mr. Heckles.

speaker: s02e03c02u002
line: How did this happen?

speaker: s02e03c02u003
line: He musta been sweepin'. They found a broom in his hand.

speaker: s02e03c02u004
line: That's terrible.

speaker: s02e03c02u005
line: I know. I was sweepin' yesterday. It coulda been me.

speaker: s02e03c02u006
line: Sure, sweepin'. You never know.

speaker: s02e03c02u007
line: You never know.

speaker: s02e03c02u008
line: Ok, it's very faint, but I can still sense him in the building. Go into the light, Mr. Heckles!

speaker: s02e03c02u009
line: Ok, Phoebe.

speaker: s02e03c02u010
line: I'm sorry, but sometimes they need help. That's fine. Go ahead and scoff. You know, there're a lot of things that I don't believe in, but that doesn't mean they're not true.

speaker: s02e03c02u011
line: Such as?

speaker: s02e03c02u012
line: Like crop circles, or the Bermuda triangle, or evolution?

speaker: s02e03c02u013
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What, you don't, uh, you don't believe in evolution?

speaker: s02e03c02u014
line: Nah. Not really.

speaker: s02e03c02u015
line: You don't believe in evolution?

speaker: s02e03c02u016
line: I don't know, it's just, you know...monkeys, Darwin, you know, it's a, it's a nice story, I just think it's a little too easy.

speaker: s02e03c02u017
line: Too easy? Too...The process of every living thing on this planet evolving over millions of years from single-celled organisms, too easy?

speaker: s02e03c02u018
line: Yeah, I just don't buy it.

speaker: s02e03c02u019
line: Uh, excuse me. Evolution is not for you to buy, Phoebe. Evolution is scientific fact, like, like, like the air we breathe, like gravity.

speaker: s02e03c02u020
line: Ok, don't get me started on gravity.

speaker: s02e03c02u021
line: You uh, you don't believe in gravity?

speaker: s02e03c02u022
line: Well, it's not so much that you know, like I don't believe in it, you know, it's just...I don't know, lately I get the feeling that I'm not so much being pulled down as I am being pushed.

speaker: s02e03c02u023
line: Uh-Oh. It's Isaac Newton, and he's pissed.

speaker: s02e03c03u001
line: There she is. And over there, that's the other one. This is Mr. Buddy Boyle, Mr. Heckles' attorney. He'd like to talk to you.

speaker: s02e03c03u002
line: What can we do for you?

speaker: s02e03c03u003
line: All right, kids. Here's the deal. According to my client's will, he wants to leave all his earthly possessions to "the noisy girls in the apartment above mine".

speaker: s02e03c03u004
line: Well, what about his family?

speaker: s02e03c03u005
line: He didn't have any.

speaker: s02e03c03u006
line: Ok, so let's talk money.

speaker: s02e03c03u007
line: All right, there was none. Let's talk signing. You be noisy girl number one, you be noisy girl number two.

speaker: s02e03c05u001
line: How can you not believe in evolution?

speaker: s02e03c05u002
line: Just don't. Look at this funky shirt!

speaker: s02e03c05u003
line: Pheebs, I have studied evolution my entire adult life. Ok, I can tell you, we have collected fossils from all over the world that actually show the evolution of different species, ok? You can literally see them evolving through time.

speaker: s02e03c05u004
line: Really? You can actually see it?

speaker: s02e03c05u005
line: You bet. In the U.S., China, Africa, all over.

speaker: s02e03c05u006
line: See, I didn't know that.

speaker: s02e03c05u007
line: Well, there you go.

speaker: s02e03c05u008
line: Huh. So now, the real question is, who put those fossils there, and why?

speaker: s02e03c06u001
line: Hey, look at this. "My Big Book of Grievances."

speaker: s02e03c06u002
line: Hey, there's me! April 17th. Excessive noise. Italian guy comes homes with a date. Hey Chandler, look, you're in here too.

speaker: s02e03c06u003
line: April 18th, excessive noise. Italian guy's gay roommate comes home with the dry-cleaning. Well that's excellent.

speaker: s02e03c06u004
line: Monica, Monica, look at this lamp. Is this tacky or what? We have to have this.

speaker: s02e03c06u005
line: Rache, I think we have enough regular lamps.

speaker: s02e03c06u006
line: What? Come on, it's not like I'm asking for this girly clock or anything, which, by the way, I also think is very cool.

speaker: s02e03c06u007
line: It doesn't go with any of my stuff.

speaker: s02e03c06u008
line: Well, what about my stuff?

speaker: s02e03c06u009
line: You don't have any stuff.

speaker: s02e03c06u010
line: You still think of it as your apartment, don't you?

speaker: s02e03c06u011
line: No.

speaker: s02e03c06u012
line: Yes you do. You think of it as your apartment, and I'm just somebody who rents a room.

speaker: s02e03c06u013
line: Mmmmm.

speaker: s02e03c06u014
line: Ok, while you "mmm" on it for awhile, I'm gonna go find a place for my new lamp.

speaker: s02e03c07u001
line: Ok, Pheebs. See how I'm making these little toys move? Opposable thumbs. Without evolution, how do you explain opposable thumbs?

speaker: s02e03c07u002
line: Maybe the overlords needed them to steer their spacecrafts.

speaker: s02e03c07u003
line: Please tell me you're joking.

speaker: s02e03c07u004
line: Look, can't we just say that you believe in something, and I don't.

speaker: s02e03c07u005
line: No, no, Pheebs, we can't, ok, because--

speaker: s02e03c07u006
line: What is this obsessive need you have to make everyone agree with you? No, what's that all about? I think, I think maybe it's time you put Ross under the microscope.

speaker: s02e03c07u007
line: Is there blood coming out of my ears?

speaker: s02e03c09u001
line: Hey, Rache. You know what we haven't played in a while?

speaker: s02e03c09u002
line: What?

speaker: s02e03c09u003
line: Hide the Lamp.

speaker: s02e03c09u004
line: Monica, let it go.

speaker: s02e03c09u005
line: Did you know I was allergic to shellfish?

speaker: s02e03c09u006
line: Well, then, you'll just have to eat the other lamps.

speaker: s02e03c10u001
line: Uh-oh. It's Scary Scientist Man.

speaker: s02e03c10u002
line: Ok, Phoebe, this is it. In this briefcase I carry actual scientific facts. A briefcase of facts, if you will. Some of these fossils are over 200 million years old.

speaker: s02e03c10u003
line: Ok, look, before you even start, I'm not denying evolution, ok, I'm just saying that it's one of the possibilities.

speaker: s02e03c10u004
line: It's the only possibility, Phoebe.

speaker: s02e03c10u005
line: Ok, Ross, could you just open your mind like this much, ok? Wasn't there a time when the brightest minds in the world believed that the world was flat? And, up until like what, 50 years ago, you all thought the atom was the smallest thing, until you split it open, and this like, whole mess of crap came out. Now, are you telling me that you are so unbelievably arrogant that you can't admit that there's a teeny tiny possibility that you could be wrong about this?

speaker: s02e03c10u006
line: There might be, a teeny, tiny, possibility.

speaker: s02e03c10u007
line: I can't believe you caved.

speaker: s02e03c10u008
line: What?

speaker: s02e03c10u009
line: You just abandoned your whole belief system. I mean, before, I didn't agree with you, but at least I respected you. How, how, how are you going to go into work tomorrow? How, how are you going to face the other science guys? How, how are you going to face yourself? Oh! That was fun. So who's hungry?
